p: The activity of the essential oils obtained from E. maritimum basal leaves and fruits was evaluated by the broth microdilution method. Both oils were the most active against T. mentagrophytes (Minimal Inhibitory Concentration MIC = 1.56 ± 0.0 mg/mL and 7.5 ± 0.0 mg/mL, respectively) and S. aureus (MIC = 12.5 ± 0.0 mg/mL and 60 ± 0.0 mg/mL, respectively). The essential oil from basal leaves had also the moderate activity against C. albicans (MIC = 12.5 ± 0.0 mg/mL) and E. coli (MIC = 25 ± 0.0 mg/mL) ( Table 3).
